conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second from the given x-t (position-time) graph, follow these steps.
Understand the Graph: The graph shows the position x (in meters) as a function of time t (in seconds). The slope of the line on this graph represents the velocity of the car.
Identify the Slope: The slope of the line in an x-t graph is given by the change in position (Δx) divided by the change in time (Δt). Mathematically, this is expressed as: Slope = Δx/Δt.
The line passes through the point (0, 10) and the origin (0, 0).

premise: The line passes through the point (0, 10) and the origin (0, 0).
conclusion: The change in position (Δx) is 10 meters (from 0 to 10).

premise: The line passes through the point (0, 10) and the origin (0, 0).
conclusion: The change in time (Δt) is 2 seconds (from 0 to 2).
Interpret the Slope: The slope of the line represents the constant velocity of the car. Since the line is straight, the velocity is constant throughout the time interval.

premise: The slope of the line is 5 m/s.
conclusion: The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is the same as the slope of the line, which is 5 m/s.
